title: In race to arm Ukraine, U.S. faces cracks in its manufacturing might
description: The war has exposed an inability to rapidly surge production of many weapons needed for Ukraine and for America’s self-defense.

title: Chile: Attempted $32 million airport heist leaves two dead
description: An airport shootout in Chile’s capital has killed a security officer and an alleged robber in what authorities say was an attempted heist of more than $32 million in cash aboard a plane from Miami

title: Women’s Day measures by Brazil’s Lula take aim at setbacks
description: Brazil’s President Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva has announced proposals to promote and protect women after years of setbacks in their causes blamed in part on a rise in far-right forces

title: Chile: Attempted $32 million airport heist leaves two dead
description: An airport shootout in Chile’s capital has killed a security officer and an alleged robber in what authorities say was an attempted heist of more than $32 million in cash aboard a plane from Miami

title: Engineer detained in Egypt railroad crash that killed 4
description: Egyptian prosecutors have ordered the detention of an engineer pending an investigation into a train crash a day earlier that killed four people near Cairo

title: Israeli protests disrupt visit by US defense secretary
description: U.S. and Israeli officials say Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin has been forced to change the schedule of a planned visit to Israel due to anti-government protests that are expected to paralyze traffic across the country

title: Aid group shutters hospital in Haiti amid spike in violence
description: Doctors Without Borders says it has been forced to temporarily close its hospital in Cite Soleil given a sharp rise in gang violence that has left dozens dead in recent weeks

title: Americans found quickly, but Mexico's missing remain lost
description: When four Americans were kidnapped in the border city of Matamoros, authorities rescued the survivors after three days

title: When the earth shook: Recounting the moments quakes hit Turkey, Syria
description: At 4:17 a.m. on Feb. 6, millions of people in Turkey and Syria were shaken out of their beds by an epochal earthquake. This is what it was like to live through it.

title: Tanzania's 1st female president praises political tolerance
description: Tanzania’s President Samia Suluhu Hassan says that as the East African country’s first female leader, she has brought a new level of political tolerance to the nation

title: Palestinian police fire tear gas, disperse militant funeral
description: Palestinian security forces have fired tear gas canisters and flash grenades at angry Palestinian protesters during a funeral for a militant in the occupied West Bank

title: Harry & Meghan's daughter christened, will use royal title
description: Prince Harry and his wife Meghan announced Wednesday that their daughter had been christened in a private ceremony in California, publicly calling her a princess and revealing for the first time that they will use royal titles for their children

title: WHO fires director in Asia accused of racist misconduct
description: The World Health Organization has fired its top official in the Western Pacific

title: Officials to transfer animals, drop probe on Puerto Rico zoo
description: Federal authorities say they are dropping all investigations into Puerto Rico’s lone zoo where various species have died after reaching an agreement with the local government to transfer the animals to sanctuaries in the U.S. mainland

title: Archie and Lilibet have claimed prince and princess titles
description: Prince Harry and Meghan the news public when they announced that Lilibet was christened in California.

title: Cuba tobacco farmers recuperate after ruinous Hurricane Ian
description: A neighbor lent him a house to dry leaves, and he had a little fertilizer saved, so he plucked up the courage to plant

title: Pope bolsters women at Vatican but resistance remains
description: Pope Francis has significantly increased the Vatican’s female workforce in his 10 years as pope

title: France asks Lebanon to question 2 suspects in 1983 bombing
description: Lebnese officials say French authorities have asked Lebanese prosecutors to detain two people suspected of involvement in a 1983 bombing in Beirut that killed dozens of French troops, It is highly unlikely that Lebanese authorities will detain the suspects nearly 40 years after the attacks

title: It’s not just Swifties. Ticketmaster also enrages Eurovision fans.
description: Eurovision said tickets to the 2023 final sold out in 36 minutes. Ticketmaster’s latest saga comes after its chaotic sale of Taylor Swift tour tickets.

title: Zelensky invites McCarthy to visit Ukraine amid GOP divide over stopping Russia
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky has invited House Speaker Kevin McCarthy (R-Calif.) to visit Ukraine, amid a growing divide among GOP lawmakers over whether the United States should continue to support the country’s efforts to fight off Russian invasion.

title: Actor Nazanin Boniadi asks world to back Iran women protests
description: Actor Nazanin Boniadi is urging the world to back the protests in her native Iran calling for women’s rights and political change, saying despots fear nothing “more than a free and politically active woman.”

title: Barenboim cancels piano concert in Monaco, citing health
description: Prominent pianist and conductor Daniel Barenboim has canceled a piano recital at the Opera de Monte-Carlo due to the effects of a serious neurological condition

title: Ukraine first lady Olena Zelenska in UAE amid Russia's war
description: Ukraine’s first lady has offered spirited support to her nation’s people while visiting the United Arab Emirates, a country that still remains open to Russia despite Western sanctions

title: UN agency urges probe of schoolgirl poisonings in Iran
description: The U.N. cultural agency has expressed concern about the suspected poisoning of thousands of schoolgirls across Iran and called for investigations

title: Bindi Irwin: Doctors dismissed endometriosis as pain women ‘deal with’
description: The daughter of the late “Crocodile Hunter” Steve Irwin said on International Women's Day that doctors told her for 10 years that her endometriosis symptoms were "simply something you deal with as a woman."

title: 4 acquitted over Brussels diamond heist; almost nothing
description: Four remaining suspects in a brazen 2013 diamond heist at Brussels Airport have been acquitted on appeal

title: Mexico looks for kidnappers as 2 Americans found dead, 2 return to U.S.
description: The kidnapping of four Americans in Matamoros is under investigation, after two were found dead and two returned to the United States from Mexico.

title: Officials: 14 women, children drowned in shipwreck off Yemen
description: Yemeni officials say at least 14 women and children have died in a shipwreck off the country’s Red Sea coast

title: Flights suspended as Arctic air, snow and sleet blast UK
description: Dozens of flights have been suspended in the U.K. and some schools had to close as snow blanketed much of the country

title: Japan activists demand dual-surname option on Women's Day
description: Women’s rights activists in Japan are renewing their demand for the government to allow married couples the option to keep both of their surnames, saying the current practice in which most women face social pressure to adopt their husbands’ surnames — a prewar tradition based on paternalistic family values — widens gender inequality

title: Oldest reference to Norse god Odin found in Denmark treasure
description: Scientists have identified the oldest-known reference to the Norse god Odin on a gold disc unearthed in western Denmark in 2020

title: World marks Women's Day but abuses, inequality still rampant
description: Hundreds of thousands of people will be taking part in demonstrations, rallies, and events around the globe to mark International Women’s Day, the day established to celebrate and demand equality for half of the planet´s population

title: Migrants flee Tunisia amid arrests and racist attacks on sub-Saharan Africans
description: The crackdown and escalating violence come after racist and xenophobic remarks by Tunisian President Kais Saied.

title: Denmark hopes to pump some climate gas beneath the sea floor
description: Denmark is cutting the ribbon on an ambitious project to bury vast amounts of planet-heating carbon dioxide gas beneath the sea floor

title: US defense secretary: Egypt partnership 'essential pillar'
description: The U.S. defense secretary says America’s defense partnership with Egypt is an “essential pillar” of Washington’s commitment to the Middle East

title: Reports: Suspected drone strike in Syria kills at least 3
description: Reports say that an explosion in eastern Syria killed at least three people

title: A top South Korean actor tested positive for drugs. His downfall was swift.
description: Yoo Ah-in, who stars in globally popular films and Netflix series, faces drug abuse allegations as South Korea grapples with the realities of "idol" culture.

title: World marks Women´s Day but abuses, inequality still rampant
description: Hundreds of thousands of people will be taking part in demonstrations, rallies, and events around the globe to mark International Women´s Day, the day established to celebrate and demand equality for half of the planet´s population

title: Greek unions stage strikes after deadly rail disaster
description: Strikes by labor unions in Greece following a rail disaster that killed 57 people have disrupted public transport in Athens, as the government faces criticism for serious security failings on the country’s busiest rail line

title: Russian Wagner Group chief claims extended gains in Bakhmut
description: The owner of Russia’s Wagner Group military company says that his troops have extended their gains in the key Ukrainian stronghold of Bakhmut as fierce fighting has continued in the war’s longest battle

title: Indian army mortar shell kills 3 in training misfire
description: A government official says three people were killed when an Indian army mortar shell fired during a training session fell short of its target and hit a village house in the country’s east

title: Kenyan senator campaigns against stigma around menstruation
description: Kenyan senator Gloria Orwoba has said that she attended parliament while wearing a white pantsuit stained by her menstrual blood in order to combat the stigma surrounding women’s monthly periods

title: UN: Afghanistan is world's most repressive country for women
description: The United Nations says that since the Taliban takeover of Afghanistan, the country has become the most repressive in the world for women and girls

title: Violent clashes in Georgia over ‘foreign influence’ bill opposed by West
description: The U.S. has compared the bill, which puts more restrictions on some media and rights groups, to a draconian Russian law used to harass activists.

title: Ukraine live briefing: Kyiv vows to hold Bakhmut; pro-Ukraine saboteurs may be behind Nord Stream blasts, officials say
description: Western officials suspect Ukraine partisans may be behind the September explosions that damaged the Nord Stream natural gas pipelines.

title: Russia eyes pressure tactics to lure fleeing tech workers home
description: Thousands of high-skilled employees fled Russia because of the war in Ukraine, relying on pandemic-era remote work routines to live abroad, and, in some cases, not telling their bosses.

title: Women enlist in Colombia's army for first time in 25 years
description: For the first time in 25 years, Colombia has opened military service to women

title: It’s International Women’s Day. How did women’s rights fare this year?
description: From Roe v. Wade to girls losing out on education in Afghanistan and women protesting in Iran, how the ground shook for women around the world in the past year.

title: The U.S.-China rift is only growing wider
description: After President Xi Jinping accused the United States of seeking to contain, encircle and suppress his country, his foreign minister warned that conflict could be inevitable.
